item.title: Why Red Dead Redemption May Never Have the Same Growth Potential as Grand Theft Auto
item.description:
Rockstar has a storied development portfolio, but none of its IP have reached the same level of cultural relevance and success as Red Dead Redemption and Grand Theft Auto . Indeed, these two franchises, despite their clear differences, are more or less the two release pillars of the fabled studio, forming almost the entirety of its 2010s release calendar.

This can be expected to remain Rockstar's modus operandi for a while still, as Grand Theft Auto 6 is slated to release in 2026, making it Rockstar's first official, new release of the decade. It will follow 2018's Red Dead Redemption 2 —a game that shook the games industry to its core, despite being something of a pleasant surprise when it was first announced: back in 2010, when the first Red Dead Redemption launched, it wasn't widely assumed that the IP would be spun into a broader franchise. After all, this was during the era of L.A. Noire , Max Payne 3 , and other Rockstar games that have seemingly been forgotten; there was no guarantee that the developer would be looking for another long-lasting series alongside GTA . But regardless of Red Dead Redemption 's popularity, there's reason to believe that it may never achieve the same legacy status as GTA , which can effectively be developed indefinitely.

Why Red Dead Redemption Can't Spawn Countless New Games, but GTA Can

Red Dead Redemption Is Locked into a Highly Specific Setting

Grand Theft Auto can be broadly described as "contemporary," in the sense that its games follow characters in the modern age. But "contemporary" is something of a broad term, and can apply to several different decades and eras. This is why GTA: Vice City can take place in the 1980s without feeling out-of-step with GTA 5 , which takes place in the early 2010s. Essentially, as long as there are cars, densely populated cities, and guns, any setting can work for Grand Theft Auto . It's also essential to note that GTA is an anthology series, with each new entry following a distinct cast, often in a new location.

Red Dead Redemption doesn't have such luxuries. Clearly established as a wild-west narrative, the Red Dead IP is inextricable from its frontier locales and turn-of-the-century setting: a theoretical Red Dead Redemption 3 couldn't reasonably take place in 1950s New York, for instance. Put another way, the western genre is restricted to one sort of setting, both geographic and temporal, which gives Red Dead a lot less room to grow compared to GTA , which has already demonstrated its flexibility via its diverse portfolio. And while GTA follows a new cast with each entry, the Red Dead Redemption games center specifically on the Van der Linde Gang . A pivot to a completely new group of characters is possible, but seems less likely, given the precedent set by RDR2 .

Red Dead Revolver predates Red Dead Redemption , and arguably sets a precedent for an anthology format. Still, the series is restricted by its aforementioned genre conventions.

Red Dead Redemption's Limited Scope Isn't as Bad as It Seems

While some gamers might dream of a world with infinite Red Dead Redemption and GTA releases, that's simply not realistic. Moreover, if Rockstar were to develop myriad Red Dead sequels, it would lock the studio out from other creative endeavors, which would be a shame, no doubt.

Red Dead Redemption may serve as an important reminder that not every good video game IP needs to be spun off into a long-running, consistent series. In fact, many games, like so many other works of art, are powerful by virtue of their finite nature. Red Dead Redemption and Red Dead Redemption 2 are hard-hitting, stand-alone western games—they don't need to spawn countless, potentially forced, sequels.

America, 1899. The end of the wild west era has begun as lawmen hunt down the last remaining outlaw gangs. Those who will not surrender or succumb are killed. After a robbery goes badly wrong in the western town of Blackwater, Arthur Morgan and the Van der Linde gang are forced to flee. With federal agents and the best bounty hunters in the nation massing on their heels, the gang must rob, steal and fight their way across the rugged heartland of America in order to survive. As deepening internal divisions threaten to tear the gang apart, Arthur must make a choice between his own ideals and loyalty to the gang who raised him. From the creators of Grand Theft Auto V and Red Dead Redemption, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an epic tale of life in America at the dawn of the modern age.

item.title: Rematch: Achievement/Trophy Guide
item.description:
There are 37 Achievements in Rematch and thus 38 Trophies for those on PlayStation 5, as there is always the Platinum Trophy for completing all the others. Thankfully, most of the Rematch Achievements are fairly easy, and players have a good shot at unlocking them all . Some, however, such as having to run 170 km or save 100 goals, will naturally require players to play for many hours.

All Achievements & Trophies In Rematch

Name

Description

How to Unlock

Team first!

Deliver your first assist.

Your teammate doesn't have to score immediately after the pass. The timing is quite generous.

Make them shine

Deliver an assist leading to an equalizer.

This requires your team to be down by one goal.

Eyes Closed

Deliver an assist with a no-look pass.

Run into the corner to get the ball and, without turning your character, perform a backwards cross for someone to volley in.

New Look

Customize an outfit slot on a character.

Outfits are under Equipment in the Customization menu.

Goal!

Score your first goal.

This guide on scoring in Rematch may help.

Pinball

Score a goal off the woodwork.

This means the ball hits the post or crossbar and then goes in.

Acrobat

Score a goal with an acrobatic volley shot.

Shoot when the ball is coming in high from a cross or the back wall. However, to do it over the head and count as acrobatic, players must turn their camera toward the goal, but have their character face away.

Marathon runner

Run 42,195 km.

This will take over two hours of running in the game. Move around as a keeper to unlock this faster.

Clean sheet

Win a match without conceding any goals.

Focus on defending the entire game, as nobody else on your team can be relied upon to do this.

Can't lose

Win 3 matches in a row.

Defending is the best way to win games, especially in beginner games, as few others will do it.

Starting blocks

Win your first match.

This will happen naturally.

The Special One

Win the MVP award for the first time.

Tackling, intercepting, and passing are the best ways to score high.

Competitor

Win your first ranked match.

You must reach Lvl 5 to unlock ranked.

Pro

Reach level 10.

Simply play games and try to achieve high personal scores. This will take around 10 hours to reach.

Not in my house!

As goalkeeper, save a shot on target in overtime.

Overtime happens when the game is tied at the end of full time. Next goal wins.

Shopping

Acquire your first item.

You can get free items from the free battle pass in the Progression menu. You also gain the blue currency 'Blocks' upon leveling up, and these can be spent in the Store or in the Customization menu.

Mr Fundamentals

Complete 5 workshops with bronze medals minimum.

Go into the Practice menu and complete workshops, such as Gates Track. Bronze is fairly easy to achieve.

Back on track

Complete your first workshop.

These are found in the Practice menu and are great for learning the game.

Vista

Deliver 30 assists.

Learn all the different ways to pass, such as using lob balls or even shooting off the back wall to set up a volley for teammates.

Maestro

Deliver 100 assists.

Expect this to take many games, especially as you have to rely on teammates to finish. Use the minimap to see where others are, and listen out for them calling out.

Post to post

Deliver an assist as goalkeeper.

Use the shoot button to perform a long kick to a lone striker up front. The rest is down to them.

Alley-oop

Deliver an assist with a rebound on a wall.

Shoot or pass above the net. This is actually one of the best ways to set up goals.

Serial scorer

Score 30 goals.

There are many different ways to score, such as rainbow flicking over the keeper, lobbing them, scoring off the back wall, and using skills past the keeper. Try to find space and stay away from the keeper when waiting for the ball.

Golden boots

Score 100 goals.

This will take many games even for the best strikers, and if players focus on this too much and ignore defending, they will likely lose lots of games.

Hats off

Score a hat trick.

This means 3 goals in one game.

Winner

Win 30 matches in any game mode.

Playing with friends can help, as passing is the key to Rematch . Always make sure to defend too, and learn the basics of goalkeeping, as you will have to go in net once a game normally.

Versatile

Deliver an assist, score a goal, and perform a save in the same match.

If you've already scored and assisted in a game, consider volunteering to go in net for the save.

Expert

Reach level 30.

Expect this to take over 30 hours of game time. Try to get the daily win each day.

Making History

The beginning of an amazing career.

This is unlocked when players complete all the other Achievements.

Rampart

As a goalkeeper, perform 30 saves.

Try not to be baited by shots off the back wall. Also, make sure to hold the defensive goalkeeper stance if the ball is coming directly at you.

Golden gloves

As a goalkeeper, perform 100 saves.

To complete this quicker, go in goal even when you aren't assigned the position from kickoff. Most players will be happy to skip keeper duty.

Fashion victim

Collect 15 items.

Unlock free items from the battle pass in the Progression menu. All you need to do is play.

Ultra Trail

Run 170 km.

Expect this to potentially take well over 10 hours of gameplay.

No pain no gain

Complete 5 workshops with gold medals.

The easiest are: The Wall, Shooting Range, Whack a Mole, Hoops, and Protect Ball. For the latter, players can use these tips on avoiding tackles.

Guardian angel

As goalkeeper, save a shot on target in overtime.

Overtime occurs when the game is tied at the end of time. The next goal wins.

It's just a game.

Complete the prologue.

This only takes around 5-10 minutes. It will also teach players all the mechanics of Rematch , so it is highly recommended.

Power of friendship

Complete a match with at least one player in your squad.

Players need to invite a friend. This will be easier when crossplay is added.

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: Dead by Daylight Update Adds Five Nights at Freddy's Springtrap
item.description:
It’s official, Springtrap, the villainous animatronic from the Five Nights at Freddy ’s franchise, has made its debut in the asymmetrical horror Dead by Daylight , where players can now control “The Yellow Rabbit” as a playable killer. Dead by Daylight first hit the gaming scene back in 2016, boasting thrilling multiplayer action in one-versus-four matches, where someone takes on the role of an iconic killer from the growing horror genre to hunt the remaining survivors.

Developer Behaviour Interactive announced that Dead by Daylight was collaborating with the Five Nights at Freddy ’s series back in May, alongside news of another union with CD Projekt’s The Witcher game series. Scott Cawthon's Five Nights at Freddy ’s began as a simple survival horror game, where players had to last the night working as a security guard in Freddy Fazbear’s Pizza restaurant dotted with killer animatronics, and the concept has now encompassed a slew of video game sequels, novels, and movie adaptations.

Posted on Twitter under the official Dead by Daylight account, Behaviour confirmed Springtrap was now available to control as a playable killer within the anticipated Five Nights at Freddy ’s chapter. Flaunting the ability to launch projectiles and fleshed out with intriguing lore, “The Animatronic” will surely give killers an entertaining hunt, and there’s also the Stack of Pizzas badge and Vent Crawl banner to check out in the new chapter as well. Springtrap’s Dead by Daylight variant boasts several perks and add-ons to use to the killer’s advantage, including the character’s unique Phantom Fear perk, and fans have nothing but praise for the addition so far.

Dead by Daylight Adds Five Nights at Freddy's Springtrap as a Playable Killer

The Animatronic’s Fazbear's Fright special power in Dead by Daylight is bound to be a big hit with fans of both games, and players are hoping the queue times aren’t too long because of the new chapter’s popularity. Twitter users shared a lot of praise for the FNAF chapter’s trailers and jumped on the trend of calling Springtrap’s addition “absolute cinema.”

Adding to the Five Nights at Freddy ’s excitement, a Dead by Daylight leak has teased another crossover with the Resident Evil franchise. Advised to be taken with a pinch of salt, the collaboration will reportedly feature Resident Evil 7 and 8 in the November licensed chapter, and feature Jack Baker as the killer, with Ethan and Rosemary Winters playing the survivors. It’s clear now is a great time to be both a horror fan and a gamer, and DbD ’s crossovers continue to be its strong suit.

item.title: What to Do First in SCUM
item.description:
SCUM is a hardcore survival game that can be pretty overwhelming for first-time players. However, once you get used to mechanics, it's one of the best online survival experiences out there. Getting used to things is easier said than done, though, because even if the game has a tutorial at the beginning, it won't hold anyone's hand when it comes to actually surviving on the island.

This guide is all about teaching players what to do on their first time dropping onto the island. There are plenty of things to remember in SCUM , but if all you're concerned about is not dying in the first five minutes, then this guide should help you out.

Best Things to Do First in SCUM

If you're dropping in for the first time, you'll likely have nothing but the clothes on your back and DEENA, the AI who'll teach you the game's basic controls. DEENA's tutorial should give you a good idea on how to gather and craft items as well as how to navigate the game's menus, and if you finish her short chain of tutorial tasks, you should now have a basic grasp of how to do the very basics.

Still, you'll likely be left wondering what to do next after the tutorial. SCUM's map is huge, and with your hunger and thirst meters constantly depleting, you'll be pressed for time. Here's what you should do after completing the tutorial.

Craft Basic Tools Fast

After the tutorial, you should have a Stone Knife, an Improvised Wooden Spear, a basic wooden bow, and an Improvised Courier Bag on you. The latter two are alright for beginners, but we strongly recommend ditching the knife and spear for a Stone Axe .

To get a Stone Axe, you'll need the following:

  • 1 Small Stone Axe Head (made from two Small Stones)
  • 1 Long Wooden Stick or 1 Short Wooden Stick
  • 1 Tree Bark Rope (or any rope)

The Stone Axe can cut down trees and other small objects, and it's a decent starting melee weapon too. More importantly, it'll only save you some precious inventory space.

As a reminder, before venturing deeper into the island, make sure to have these items:

  • Stone Axe
  • Wooden Bow
  • A full stack of 12 Wooden Arrows

Look for Food and Water

Once you have a basic kit, it's time to find some food and water. The latter should be easy enough — open your map and look for a nearby body of inland water , like ponds, lakes, and rivers. Do not drink seawater.

Food, on the other hand, is trickier. You can try the following if you're getting peckish:

  • Scavenge for fruits, berries, insects, and mushrooms
  • Loot POIs like villages, towns, and military bases
  • Hunt animals
  • Go fishing

For new players, your best bet at early food is bushes and fruit trees . If you're lucky, you might find a farm that has a variety of crops already planted. In any case, once you find a food source, make a campfire and cook whatever you find.

Claim Land

Ideally, you should look for food and water near some trace of civilization like a village or town . You'll want to find these traces of civilization as they'll have the materials you need to craft a Flag , which acts as a land claim block. In order to build bases, you need set a Flag down first — doing so will also prevent hostile NPCs from spawning nearby.

To place buildables, open the Crafting menu and select the Base Building tab on the upper-right.

To craft a Flag, you need the following:

  • Metal Scraps
  • Rags
  • Bolts or Nails
  • Tool Box

You can craft Rags by cutting clothes dropped by Puppets. Meanwhile, Scraps and Bolts/Nails can be found inside warehouses, offices, or anywhere you'd expect pieces of construction hardware would be.

As for the Tool Box, you can either find a regular Tool Box or a Small Tool Box while exploring, or you can craft an Improvised Tool Box using the following:

  • 2 Metal Scraps
  • 2 Wooden Plank (cut logs from trees)
  • 1 Bolt
  • 1 Nail
  • Any blunt tool

Once you've planted a Flag, you can now start building a base. We recommend setting up a Flag in an abandoned village or homestead and just claim a nearby building as your shelter.

What to Do Next?

The steps outlined above should be enough to give you a basic idea of how to get a foothold in SCUM . At this point, you're free to explore the map and create more camps using the steps above. If you're not sure where to go, we recommend doing the following:

  • Exploring bigger POIs like cities and military installations
  • Visiting traders and doing quests
  • Searching for hidden military bunkers

item.title: The Sims 4: Nature's Calling Event Guide
item.description:
The Sims 4 is launching a cozy event in anticipation for its upcoming DLC, the Enchanted by Nature expansion pack. Whether gamers want to start planning their homes for the pack or creating the household that they want to use to try it out, the Nature's Calling event gives players the unique opportunity to earn some nature-themed Sims 4 items for free.

This guide will tell players what they need to know about the Nature's Calling event so they can make sure that they're able to participate and complete as many quests as possible before it becomes permanently unavailable.

When Does Nature's Calling Start in The Sims 4?

Nature's Calling Event Start Date and Time

The Nature's Calling event will take place in-game in The Sims 4 , and it begins on June 24. This event has the release time as previous events and expansion packs. Therefore, Nature's Calling Quests will become available in The Sims 4 on Tuesday, June 24, at 9 AM PT / 12 PM ET / 4 PM UTC .

Nature's Calling Event Rewards in The Sims 4

Players will earn Event Points as they complete Nature's Calling weekly quests in The Sims 4 . As they increase their number of Event Points, they will unlock more rewards. Each week allows them to obtain four rewards, but if they have access to more DLC packs, they may receive additional quests and unlock items that would've otherwise been granted the following week.

Week 1

Week 2

Week 3

Week 4

  • Reclaimed Woodworking Table
  • Odonata Glasses
  • Reclaimed Wood Wall
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #1

  • Reclaimed Wood Dining Chair woodworking recipe
  • Flowing Fronds Swimwear
  • Foraged Feast food recipe
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #2

  • Nature Soundscapes radio station
  • Reclaimed Wood Dining Table woodworking recipe
  • Rings of Growth tattoo
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #3

  • The Wooden Throne outhouse
  • Cove Stones decorative rocks
  • Trail Sandals
  • Touch Grass Weekly, Issue #4

On top of the recipes, CAS and Build Mode items, players will also obtain issues of Touch Grass Weekly, as part of an event exclusive collection.

Nature's Calling Quests Schedule

When Do Nature's Calling Quests Come Out?

Nature's Calling Quests will release on a weekly basis for four weeks, and then the event will remain live for an extra three weeks. The first set of quests is set to release once the event launches and the rest can be expected at the same time the following week. Taking this information into consideration, here's is the most likely release date for each set of Nature's Calling Weekly Quests:

  • Week 1 Quests: June 24, at 10 AM PT
  • Week 2 Quests: July 1, at 10 AM PT
  • Week 3 Quests: July 8, at 10 AM PT
  • Week 4 Quests: July 15, at 10 AM PT

How Long Is the Nature's Calling Event in The Sims 4?

Nature's Calling Event End Date and Time

As mentioned above, fans will have an additional three weeks to complete the quests after the final set of quests becomes available. The Nature's Calling Event in The Sims 4 will be live until August 5, 2025 . Gamers have until then to complete as many quests as they can in order to get enough Event Points to unlock all freebies.
